member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter
member.summary: Represents a local Bluetooth adapter.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.BluetoothAddress
member.summary: Gets the device address.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.IsClassicSupported
member.summary: Gets a boolean indicating if the adapter supports the Bluetooth Classic transport type.
member.remarks: Always returns false for iOS, macOS and tvOS.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.IsLowEnergySupported
member.summary: Gets a boolean indicating if the adapater supports Low Energy Bluetooth Transport type.
member.remarks: Always returns false for Windows Desktop.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.Name
member.summary: Gets the Name of the adapter.
member.remarks: On most platforms this is not separately editable from the machine name.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothCacheMode
member.summary: Indicates whether certain Bluetooth API methods should operate on values cached in the system or retrieve those values from the Bluetooth device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothCacheMode.Cached
member.summary: Use system-cached values.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothCacheMode.Uncached
member.summary: Retrieve values from the Bluetooth device.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothClassOfDevice
member.summary: Provides functionality to determine the Bluetooth Class Of Device (Bluetooth COD) information for a device.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothClassOfDevice.FromRawValue(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a BluetoothClassOfDevice object from a raw integer value representing the Major Class, Minor Class and Service Capabilities of the device.
member.param: The raw integer value from which to create the BluetoothClassOfDevice object.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothClassOfDevice.RawValue
member.summary: Gets the Bluetooth Class Of Device information, represented as an integer value.
member.value: The Bluetooth Class Of Device information, represented as a raw integer value.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothClassOfDevice.MajorClass
member.summary: Gets the Major Class code of the Bluetooth device.
member.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies the device's Major Class code.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothClassOfDevice.MinorClass
member.summary: Gets the Minor Class code of the Bluetooth device.
member.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies the device's Minor Class code.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothClassOfDevice.ServiceCapabilities
member.summary: Gets the service capabilities of the device.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothClassOfDevice.ToString
member.summary: Returns the Major/Minor device class as a string.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothConnectionStatus
member.summary: Indicates the connection status of the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothConnectionStatus.Disconnected
member.summary: The device is disconnected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothConnectionStatus.Connected
member.summary: The device is connected.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice
member.summary: Represents a Bluetooth device.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice.GetDeviceSelector
member.summary: Gets an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string for identifying all Bluetooth devices. This string is passed to the or CreateWatcher method in order to get a list of Bluetooth devices.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice.GetDeviceSelectorFromClassOfDevice(InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothClassOfDevice)
member.summary: Creates an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) filter string from a BluetoothClassOfDevice object. The AQS string is passed into the CreateWatcher method to return a collection of DeviceInformation objects.
member.param: The class of device used for constructing the AQS string.
member.returns: An AQS string that can be passed as a parameter to the CreateWatcher method.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice.GetDeviceSelectorFromPairingState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) filter string that contains a query for Bluetooth devices that are either paired or unpaired. The AQS string is passed into the CreateWatcher method to return a collection of objects.
member.param: The current pairing state for Bluetooth devices used for constructing the AQS string. Bluetooth devices can be either paired (true) or unpaired (false). The AQS Filter string will request scanning to be performed when the pairingState is false.
member.returns: An AQS string that can be passed as a parameter to the CreateWatcher method.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice.BluetoothAddress
member.summary: Gets the device address.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice.ClassOfDevice
member.summary: Gets the Bluetooth Class Of Device information of the device.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice.ConnectionStatus
member.summary: Gets the connection status of the device.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice.DeviceId
member.summary: Gets the device Id.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice.Name
member.summary: Gets the Name of the device.

member.name: E:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice.NameChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the name of the device has changed.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError
member.summary: Specifies common Bluetooth error cases.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.Success
member.summary: The operation was successfully completed or serviced.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.RadioNotAvailable
member.summary: The Bluetooth radio was not available. This error occurs when the Bluetooth radio has been turned off.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.ResourceInUse
member.summary: The operation cannot be serviced because the necessary resources are currently in use.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.DeviceNotConnected
member.summary: The operation cannot be completed because the remote device is not connected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.OtherError
member.summary: An unexpected error has occurred.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.DisabledByPolicy
member.summary: The operation is disabled by policy.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.NotSupported
member.summary: The operation is not supported on the current Bluetooth radio hardware.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.DisabledByUser
member.summary: The operation is disabled by the user.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.ConsentRequired
member.summary: The operation requires consent.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothError.TransportNotSupported
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass
member.summary: Indicates the Major Class code of the device, which is the general family of device with which the device is associated.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used when a more specific Major Class code is not suitable.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.Computer
member.summary: A computer. Example devices are desktop, notebook, PDA and organizer.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.Phone
member.summary: A phone. Example devices are cellular, cordless, pay phone and modem.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.NetworkAccessPoint
member.summary: A LAN or network Access Point.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.AudioVideo
member.summary: An audio or video device. Example devices are headset, speaker, stereo, video display and VCR.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.Peripheral
member.summary: A peripheral device. Examples are mouse, joystick and keyboard.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.Imaging
member.summary: An imaging device. Examples are printer, scanner, camera and display.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.Wearable
member.summary: A wearable device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.Toy
member.summary: A toy.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMajorClass.Health
member.summary: A health device. An example is a heart rate monitor.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMinorClass
member.summary: Indicates the Minor Class code of the device, which is the general family of device with which the device is associated.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.BluetoothMinorClass.Uncategorized
member.summary: Use when a Minor Class code has not been assigned.

member.summary: Represents an RFCOMM service ID.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.Rfcomm.RfcommServiceId.SerialPort
member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Serial Port (SPP) service (with short id 0x1101).

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.Rfcomm.RfcommServiceId.DialupNetworking
member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Dial-up Networking (DUN) service (with short id 0x1103).

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.Rfcomm.RfcommServiceId.IrMCSync
member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Synchronization service (with short id 0x1104).

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.Rfcomm.RfcommServiceId.ObexObjectPush
member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized OBEX Object Push service (with short id 0x1105).

member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized OBEX File Transfer service (with short id 0x1106).

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.Rfcomm.RfcommServiceId.Headset
member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Headset Profile (HSP) (with short id 0x1108).

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.Rfcomm.RfcommServiceId.AVRemoteControl
member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Audio/Video Remote Control Profile (AVRCP) (with short id 0x110E).

member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Basic Imaging service (with short id 0x111A).

member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Hands-free Profile (HFP) (with short id 0x111E).

member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Basic Printing service (with short id 0x1118).

member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Phone Book Access (PSE) service (with short id 0x112F).

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.Rfcomm.RfcommServiceId.GenericFileTransfer
member.summary: Creates a object corresponding to the service id for the standardized Generic File Transfer service (with short id 0x1202).

member.summary: Retrieves the 128-bit service id.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.Rfcomm.RfcommServiceId.AsShortId
member.summary: Converts the RfcommServiceId to a 32-bit service id if possible.
member.returns: Returns the 32-bit service id if the RfcommServiceId represents a standardized service.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Devices.Bluetooth.Rfcomm.RfcommServiceId.AsString
member.summary: Converts the RfcommServiceId to a string.
member.returns: Returns the string representation of the 128-bit service id.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceInformation
member.summary: Represents a picker flyout that contains a list of devices for the user to choose from.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceInformation.Id
member.summary: A string representing the identity of the device.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceInformation.Name
member.summary: The name of the device.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceInformation.Pairing
member.summary: Gets the information about the capabilities for this device to pair.
member.value: The pairing information for this device.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceInformation.ToString
member.summary: Returns the Id of the .

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceInformationPairing
member.summary: Contains information and enables pairing for a device.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceInformationPairing.CanPair
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the device can be paired.
member.value: True if the device can be paired, otherwise false.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceInformationPairing.IsPaired
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the device is currently paired.
member.value: True if the device is currently paired, otherwise false.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingKinds
member.summary: Indicates the kinds of pairing supported by your application or requested by the system. As an input value, use this value to indicate what kinds of pairing your application supports. When this datatype is received as an output value, it indicates the kind of pairing requested by the system. In this case, your code will need to respond accordingly.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingKinds.None
member.summary: No pairing is supported.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingKinds.ConfirmOnly
member.summary: The application must confirm they wish to perform the pairing action. You can present an optional confirmation dialog to the user. With a value of ConfirmOnly, Accept the pairing if you want it to complete.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingKinds.DisplayPin
member.summary: The application must display the given PIN to the user. The user will then need to enter or confirm that PIN on the device that is being paired. With a value of DisplayPin, Accept the pairing if you want it to complete. If your application cancels the pairing at this point, the device might still be paired. This is because the system and the target device don't need any confirmation for this DevicePairingKinds value.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingKinds.ProvidePin
member.summary: The application must request a PIN from the user. The PIN will typically be displayed on the target device. With a value of ProvidePin, Accept the pairing and pass in the PIN as a parameter.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingKinds.ConfirmPinMatch
member.summary: The application must display the given PIN to the user and ask the user to confirm that the PIN matches the one show on the target device. With a value of ConfirmPinMatch, Accept the pairing if you want it to complete.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResult
member.summary: Contains information about the result of attempting to pair a device.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResult.Status
member.summary: Gets the paired status of the device after the pairing action completed.
member.value: The paired status of the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.Paired
member.summary: The device object is now paired.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.NotReadyToPair
member.summary: The device object is not in a state where it can be paired.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.NotPaired
member.summary: The device object is not currently paired.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.AlreadyPaired
member.summary: The device object has already been paired.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.ConnectionRejected
member.summary: The device object rejected the connection.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.TooManyConnections
member.summary: The device object indicated it cannot accept any more incoming connections.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.HardwareFailure
member.summary: The device object indicated there was a hardware failure.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.AuthenticationTimeout
member.summary: The authentication process timed out before it could complete.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.AuthenticationNotAllowed
member.summary: The authentication protocol is not supported, so the device is not paired.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.AuthenticationFailure
member.summary: Authentication failed, so the device is not paired. Either the device object or the application rejected the authentication.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.NoSupportedProfiles
member.summary: There are no network profiles for this device object to use.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.ProtectionLevelCouldNotBeMet
member.summary: The minimum level of protection is not supported by the device object or the application.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.AccessDenied
member.summary: Your application does not have the appropriate permissions level to pair the device object.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.InvalidCeremonyData
member.summary: The ceremony data was incorrect.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.PairingCanceled
member.summary: The pairing action was canceled before completion.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.OperationAlreadyInProgress
member.summary: The device object is already attempting to pair or unpair.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.RequiredHandlerNotRegistered
member.summary: Either the event handler wasn't registered or a required DevicePairingKinds was not supported.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.RejectedByHandler
member.summary: The application handler rejected the pairing.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.RemoteDeviceHasAssociation
member.summary: The remove device already has an association.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePairingResultStatus.Failed
member.summary: An unknown failure occurred.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePicker
member.summary: Represents a picker flyout that contains a list of devices for the user to choose from.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePicker.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a object.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePicker.Filter
member.summary: Gets the filter used to choose what devices to show in the picker.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePickerFilter
member.summary: Represents the filter used to determine which devices to show in the device picker. The filter parameters are OR-ed together to build the resulting filter.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DevicePickerFilter.SupportedDeviceSelectors
member.summary: Gets a list of AQS filter strings. This defaults to empty list (no filter). You can add one or more AQS filter strings to this vector and filter the devices list to those that meet one or more of the provided filters.
member.remarks:
Some platforms have limitations on the filter types they support:-
PlatformVersion supported
AndroidSupports only a small set of ClassOfDevice restrictions. , , , any other class values will display all device types.
Windows UWPNo restrictions. Additional filter types are added in Creators Update.
Windows StoreNo restrictions
Windows Phone StoreNo restrictions
Windows (Desktop Apps)Supports and .

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceUnpairingResult
member.summary: Contains information about the result of attempting to unpair a device.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceUnpairingResult.Status
member.summary: Gets the paired status of the device after the unpairing action completed.
member.value: The paired status of the device.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceUnpairingResultStatus
member.summary: The result of the unpairing action.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceUnpairingResultStatus.Unpaired
member.summary: The device object is successfully unpaired.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceUnpairingResultStatus.AlreadyUnpaired
member.summary: The device object was already unpaired.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceUnpairingResultStatus.OperationAlreadyInProgress
member.summary: The device object is currently in the middle of either a pairing or unpairing action.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceUnpairingResultStatus.AccessDenied
member.summary: The caller does not have sufficient permissions to unpair the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceUnpairingResultStatus.Failed
member.summary: An unknown failure occurred.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream
member.summary: Provides the underlying stream of data for network access.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the NetworkStream supports reading.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the stream supports seeking. This property is not currently supported.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the NetworkStream supports writing.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the data available on the stream. This property is not currently supported and always throws a NotSupportedException.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the current position in the stream. This property is not currently supported and always throws a NotSupportedException.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.Flush
member.summary: Flushes data from the stream.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads data from the NetworkStream.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the current position of the stream to the given value. This method is not currently supported and always throws a NotSupportedException.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the stream. This method always throws a NotSupportedException.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes data to the NetworkStream.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Networking.Sockets.NetworkStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the NetworkStream and optionally releases the managed resources.
